Detailed Description

Any animation object need to implement PropertyAnimatable because of setting value.

the property animation system will set the property value of the object over time.

 class myObject : public PropertyAnimatable {
 private:
  float x;
 public:
  myObject() : x(0) {}
  virtual ~myObject() {}
  void setX(float x) {this->x = x;}

  void setFloat(String name, float value)
  {
      if (name == "X") {
          setX(float);
      }
  }
 }

If your property is a float value, you need to implement this function.

Parameters:
invokeNameThe property animation system will refer to the invoke name to call current function .
valueThe property animation system will calculate a float value for this object.
